title: Level 10 Algebra Practice Test
description: Test your skills in factorising non-monic quadratics, the quadratic formula, simultaneous equations, and polynomials.

questions.question: Factorise $2x^2 + 5x + 3$.
questions.explanation: $ac = 6$. Numbers that multiply to 6 and add to 5: 2 and 3. Rewrite: $2x^2 + 2x + 3x + 3 = 2x(x+1) + 3(x+1) = (2x+3)(x+1)$.

questions.question: What is the discriminant of $x^2 - 6x + 9 = 0$?
questions.explanation: $\Delta = b^2 - 4ac = (-6)^2 - 4(1)(9) = 36 - 36 = 0$. This means there is exactly one repeated solution ($x = 3$).

questions.question: Solve the simultaneous equations $x + y = 7$ and $x - y = 3$.
questions.explanation: Add the equations: $2x = 10$, so $x = 5$. Substitute: $5 + y = 7$, so $y = 2$.

questions.question: What is the degree of the polynomial $4x^3 - 2x^5 + x - 7$?
questions.explanation: The degree is the highest power of the variable. The term $-2x^5$ has the highest power, so the degree is 5.

questions.question: If the discriminant of a quadratic equation is negative, how many real solutions does it have?
questions.explanation: When $\Delta < 0$, the square root of a negative number is not real, so there are no real solutions. The parabola does not cross the x-axis.

questions.question: Solve the simultaneous equations $2x + y = 10$ and $x - y = 2$. What is the value of $x$?
Use the quadratic formula to solve $2x^2 - 3x - 2 = 0$. Give the positive solution.
Calculate the discriminant of $x^2 + 3x + 5 = 0$.
questions.explanation: $\Delta = b^2 - 4ac = 9 - 20 = -11$. Since $\Delta < 0$, this equation has no real solutions.

questions.question: Factorise $5x^2 + 13x + 6$. Write your answer in the form $(ax + b)(cx + d)$.
questions.explanation: $ac = 30$. Numbers that multiply to 30 and add to 13: 3 and 10. Rewrite: $5x^2 + 3x + 10x + 6 = x(5x+3) + 2(5x+3) = (5x+3)(x+2)$.
